title: How to transfer music from Spotify to Google play - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want to transfer Spotify music to Google play, you should think of the DRM protection at first. As we all know, Spotify music is protected by DRM, so that you cannot freely play them in any other places. So, you may need the help of a third-party tool like Spotify music converter. Then just follow the four steps to transfer music from Spotify to Google play. Step 1. Drag Spotify playlists to TunesKit Firstly, run TunesKit Music Converter for Spotify. Then you have two choices to add the Spotify playlists to the converter. The first one is dragging the playlists from the Spotify app to the conversion window of TunesKit. Or you can copy the link of the Spotify track to the search box of the TunesKit interface. Step 2. Set the output audio parameters Now simply go "Menu > Preference > Convert" to adjust the output preferences as you like. You are allowed to choose the output format, channel, bit rate, and sample rate. Currently, TunesKit Music Converter for Spotify fully supports some plain formats like MP3, M4A, AAC, WAV, FLAC, and M4B. You can also set the output directory and conversion speed here. Step 3. Convert protected Spotify to common audios After the above setting, click the "Convert" button to start converting Spotify music to MP3 or other formats. After the conversion, the output folder will be open automatically. You can also find the converted Spotify music files by navigating to "Converted > Search". Step 4. Transfer the converted Spotify music to Google Play Click the "Upload Music" button, and you'll be prompted to download the Music Manager. If you've already got it, then simply open it up and sign in with your Google account. Select the "Menu icon > Upload songs to Google Play", and hit Next. Select the "Other Folder" option to click the "Next" button, then locate the folder where you store Spotify music from the popup window. The Music Manager will automatically upload Spotify music files you select to Google Play.

As we all know, like Google play Music, Spotify also has two subscription services: Free and Premium. But you can only access Spotify music online but can't download the songs for playing without Spotify client. Go to try Tune4mac Spotify Audio Converter Platinum. It can help you to download Spotify songs, music, album and playlists to MP3, AAC, WAV and FLAC with CD output quality. Then you could upload the downloaded Spotify songs to Google Play Music easily.  Head to the Google Play Music website using Chrome on your computer, then sign into your Google account. Click the menu button in the top-left corner of the screen. Select the Upload music option -> Select From Your Computer button, which would allow you to find and select the downloaded Spotify song file folders to upload. You can also drag the converted Spotify folder and drop it to the screen. The upload process can take several hours, depending on how much music files you're uploading. When the process is finished, you can listen to Spotify playlist to Google Play Music successfully. The detailed tutorial through Import Spotify playlists to Google Play Music
